bug.author: brantPTS
bug.summary: Inference fails when running Faster RCNN model from ONNX model zoo

comments.comment:
Hi, I think there are 2 dimensions to this issue:
I think when you feed it random data, the model is unable to make any detections When the C# layer tries to create a tensor with no elements (number of detection boxes = 0), it throws. In Python, I get back an empty array of shape [0, 4].
So, please try following the demo in the link you pasted and try inferencing on an image where the model is sure to detect something. In legitimate cases when there is an image with no objects (or one that the model isn't able to detect), the C# layer must be able to handle it (addressed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/1976>#1976</denchmark-link> )

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hariharans29>@hariharans29</denchmark-link> Thank you for working this so promptly. I will work on preparing some real data and also will look forward to your fix for the zero dimension tensor.
Sure. The 0 dimension value tensor problem should be limited to just the c# layer (Python and C/C++ should be ok) - just FYI :)

Closing out this issue as the only takeaway for ORT was that the C# layer didn't handle creation of empty tensors (fixed via <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/1976>#1976</denchmark-link> ) and for the provided input an empty tensor is the right output. So, the result is correct.
